actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works and Transportation
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Economic Development.

official_title: A bill to abolish the Economic Development Administration, to repeal the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965, and for other purposes.
short_title: Economic Development Administration Termination Act of 1985

summary.text: Economic Development Administration Termination Act of 1985 - Repeals the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 (grants for public works projects), the Local Public Works Capital Development and Investment Act (public works employment), and title I of the Community Emergency Drought Relief Act of 1977 (community disaster relief loans) to terminate the Economic Development Administration (EDA) of the Department of Commerce. Enables the Economic Development Revolving Fund to continue in existence to: (1) receive collections and repayments of assistance extended under the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965; and (2) pay all obligations arising in connection with such Act. Directs the Secretary of Commerce to determine when the Fund is no longer needed and deposit any remaining moneys into the general fund of the Treasury. Authorizes appropriations for FY 1986 for the orderly phase-out of EDA.

titles.title: Economic Development Administration Termination Act of 1985
A bill to abolish the Economic Development Administration, to repeal the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965, and for other purposes.
